channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Firefighters report more progress against Canadian wildfires and wait for rain
item.description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia (AP) — Firefighters successfully prevented wildfires from destroying any more structures in a scenic region of British Columbia, authorities said Monday as the prospect of rain raised hopes for the effort to contain the flames.
item.dc:creator: ROB GILLIES and JIM MORRIS, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: US military aircraft carrying more than 20 Marines crashes over Australia, killing 3 and injuring others
item.description: A military aircraft with more than 20 U.S. Marines onboard crashed Sunday near Melville Island in Australia's Northern Territory. No Australians were involved in the crash.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Reporter Evan Gershkovich appeals Russia's extension of pretrial detention
item.description: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich, who has been jailed in Russia on espionage charges since March, has appealed the extension of his pretrial detention, court documents showed Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Nick Robertson, The Hill

item.title: Zimbabwe's opposition alleges 'gigantic fraud' in vote that extends the ZANU-PF party's 43-year rule
item.description: Zimbabwe’s main opposition leader has alleged “blatant and gigantic fraud” after President Emmerson Mnangagwa was declared the winner of another troubled election in the southern African nation.
item.dc:creator: Farai Mutsaka And Gerald Imray, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Wagner boss confirmed dead by Russian officials
item.description: A Russian investigation concluded on Sunday that Yevgeniy Prigozhin, the longtime leader of the Wagner Group, was killed in the aircraft crash last week that killed all those on board.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Fortinsky, The Hill

item.title: A gang in Haiti opens fire on a crowd of parishioners trying to rid the community of criminals
item.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) — A powerful gang opened fire Saturday on a large group of parishioners led by a pastor as they marched through a community armed with machetes to rid the area of gang members.
item.dc:creator: EVENS SANON, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: India lands a spacecraft near the moon's south pole, a first for the world as it joins elite club
item.description: India became the first country to land a spacecraft near the moon’s south pole on Wednesday — a historic voyage to uncharted territory that scientists believe could hold vital reserves of frozen water, and a technological triumph for the world’s most populous nation.
item.dc:creator: ASHOK SHARMA, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Study: More than 1B likely to have osteoarthritis by 2050
item.description: Globally, 595 million people had osteoarthritis in 2020, equal to 7.6% of the global population, and an increase of 132.2% in total cases since 1990.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Wornell, NewsNation

item.title: Russia: Mercenary leader Prigozhin killed in plane crash
item.description: The signal was lost in a rural region with no nearby airfields where the jet could have landed safely.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Ukraine investigates incident that killed 3 pilots while Russia attacks with cruise missiles
item.description: Ukrainian authorities have launched an investigation after a midair collision between two warplanes in the west of the country killed three pilots.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: FIFA opens case against Spanish soccer official who kissed player on lips at Women's World Cup
item.description: FIFA opened a disciplinary case Thursday against the Spanish soccer official who kissed a player on the lips while celebrating the team's victory in the Women’s World Cup final.
item.dc:creator: Graham Dunbar, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Biden honors service members killed during Afghanistan withdrawal
item.description: President Joe Biden honored 13 service members who died during an attack while the U.S. was withdrawing from Afghanistan two years ago in a statement Saturday. A bomb by the Abbey Gate at Hamid Karzai International Airport in Kabul on Aug. 26, 2021, killed 13 U.S.
item.dc:creator: Tara Suter, The Hill

item.title: Rescuers save 8 people trapped in cable car dangling above canyon in Pakistan
item.description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan (AP) — Pakistani authorities say all eight people trapped in a cable car suspended high above a canyon have been rescued. A spokesperson for state-run emergency service says army commandos rescued the six children and two adults after an hourslong operation.
item.dc:creator: RIAZ KHAN and MUNIR AHMED, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: UK's $125M AI chip investment not enough to keep pace in tech race, experts warn: 'Go big or go home'
item.description: The U.K.'s Research and Innovation group plans to buy 5,000 graphical processing units (GPUs) from Nvidia, but experts say that far more is needed to compete in the sector.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Cuban Little League coach Jose Perez goes missing at World Series
item.description: A coach with Cuba’s first-ever Little League World Series team has gone missing, a tournament official said Monday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa wins re-election after troubled vote, officials say
item.description: Authorities in Zimbabwe say President Emmerson Mnangagwa has been re-elected for a second and final term.
item.dc:creator: Farai Mutsaka, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Putin denounces sanctions on Russia during his speech for a South Africa economic summit
item.description: JOHANNESBURG (AP) — Russian President Vladimir Putin took multiple shots at the West on the opening day of an economic summit in South Africa, using a prerecorded speech that was aired on giant screens Tuesday to rail at what he called “illegitimate sanctions” on his country and threaten to cut off
item.dc:creator: GERALD IMRAY and MOGOMOTSI MAGOME, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Biden, Zelensky talk training Ukrainian fighter pilots on F-16s to mark 18 months since Russian invasion
item.description: President Biden on Thursday spoke with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to mark 18 months since Russia’s invasion and discuss training Ukrainians on F-16 fighter jets.
item.dc:creator: Alex Gangitano, The Hill

item.title: UN experts say Islamic State group almost doubled the territory they control in Mali in under a year
item.description: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — Islamic State extremists have almost doubled the territory they control in Mali in less than a year, and their al-Qaida-linked rivals are capitalizing on the deadlock and perceived weakness of armed groups that signed a 2015 peace agreement, United Nations experts said in a new
item.dc:creator: EDITH M. LEDERER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: More than 600 firefighters backed by water-dropping aircraft struggle to control wildfires in Greece
item.description: More than 600 firefighters are battling three major wildfires in Greece, two of which have been raging for days.
item.dc:creator: Elena Becatoros, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Putin ally claims Wagner boss dismissed warnings about safety following mutiny: 'To hell with it'
item.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko may be trying to "whitewash" his conversations, an expert said, as both Russia and Belarus distance themselves from the incident.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Angry reaction after Spanish soccer leader kissed a Women’s World Cup star on the mouth
item.description: MADRID (AP) — The leader of Spain’s soccer federation marred the country’s Women’s World Cup victory after kissing a player on the lips during the medal ceremony, drawing criticism for inappropriate conduct in a sport that has struggled to overcome sexism.
item.dc:creator: DAVID BRUNAT and GRAHAM DUNBAR, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: SpaceX, NASA launch international crew to space station: 'A united team with a common mission'
item.description: Four astronauts from four different countries launched from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida to the International Space Station in a SpaceX spacecraft Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Tara Suter, The Hill

item.title: British nurse Lucy Letby imprisoned for life for the murders of 7 babies and attempted murders of 6
item.description: LONDON (AP) — A former neonatal nurse who killed seven babies in her care and tried to kill six others at a hospital in northern England was sentenced Monday to life in prison with no chance of release by a judge who highlighted “the cruelty and calculation" of her actions.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Prigozhin's death could turn Russians against gov't: Ret. Lt. Col.
item.description: Retired U.S. Army Lt. Col. Daniel Davis said that the crash will cause a lot of trouble for Russia as it continues its war against Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Nichole Berlie, NewsNation

item.title: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa wins re-election after troubled vote, officials say
item.description: HARARE, Zimbabwe (AP) — Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa was re-elected for a second and final five-year term late Saturday in results announced much earlier than expected following another troubled vote in the southern African country with a history of violent and disputed elections.
item.dc:creator: FARAI MUTSAKA and GERALD IMRAY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Fukushima residents are cautious after the wrecked nuclear plant began releasing treated wastewater
item.description: IWAKI, Japan (AP) — Fish auction prices at a port south of the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant were mixed amid uncertainty over how seafood consumers will respond to the release of treated and diluted radioactive wastewater into the ocean.
item.dc:creator: MARI YAMAGUCHI, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Prigozhin's final months were overshadowed by questions about what the Kremlin had in store for him
item.description: TALLINN, Estonia (AP) — Yevgeny Prigozhin smiled as a crowd of adoring fans surrounded his black SUV on June 24 in Russia’s southern city of Rostov-on-Don and cheered him on.
item.dc:creator: DASHA LITVINOVA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Pope Francis urges Russian children to become ‘artisans of peace’ in address
item.description: Pope Francis urged children to become "artisans of peace" and "sowers of seeds of reconciliation" at the 10th National Meeting of Catholic Youth of Russia.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Jet crash in Russia kills 10 and Wagner chief was on passenger list, officials say
item.description: A business jet en route from Moscow to St. Petersburg crashed Wednesday, killing all 10 people on board, Russian emergency officials said. Mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin was on the passenger list, officials said, but it wasn't immediately clear if he was on board.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Putin's hope for AI to increase information control, end Western tech dependence largely 'aspirational'
item.description: Russia's desire to severely control the information provided to and by artificial intelligence models could also slow the development of such models and impede Russia's progress.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Russia says it confirmed Wagner leader Prigozhin died in a plane crash
item.description: Russia’s Investigative Committee has confirmed Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin was killed in a plane crash.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Sha’Carri Richardson caps comeback by winning 100-meter title at worlds
item.description: BUDAPEST, Hungary (AP) — Track, and fame, can be brutal games. Nobody felt that more over the past two years than American sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Russia says it confirmed Wagner leader Prigozhin died in a plane crash
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia’s Investigative Committee said Sunday that it confirmed that Yevgeny Prigozhin, founder and head of the mercenary force Wagner who led a short-lived armed rebellion against Russia's military, was killed in a plane crash.
item.dc:creator: AP, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Women working in Antarctica say they were left to fend for themselves against sexual harassers
item.description: Many women who work at McMurdo Station, the main United States research base in Antarctica, say the isolated environment and macho culture have allowed sexual harassment and assault to flourish.
item.dc:creator: Nick Perry, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Putin breaks silence on plane crash that presumably killed Wagner leaders
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has broken his silence on the plane crash that killed top leaders of the Wagner mercenary group.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Takeaways from AP's investigation into sexual harassment and assault at Antarctica's McMurdo Station
item.description: Many women who work at McMurdo Station, the main United States research base in Antarctica, say the isolated environment and macho culture have allowed sexual harassment and assault to flourish.
item.dc:creator: Nick Perry, Associated Press, KPRC 2
